::Firaxis::
       He glances back at her and grins inwardly.  "I believe I said 'You'd 
do well to remember that.'"  He thinks for a moment.  "It is what it is.  You 
should not group people based on their species but based on their actions.  
And you should remember that when you're eventually outnumbered and 
outgunned."  He raises his hand to cut off any objections.  "I know, you'll 
never be outmatched by these infidels. But they may, eventually have some 
brilliant idea that confuses you long enough for them to defeat you.  It 
happens to the best of us."  He nods curtly.  "Now if you'll excuse me, I 
have a dog to find."

--part1_9.263057e2.29e5bf8e_boundary
Content-Type: text/html; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

<HTML><FONT FACE=arial,helvetica><FONT  SIZE=2>::Firaxis::
<BR>       He glances back at her and grins inwardly.  "I believe I said 'You'd do well to remember that.'"  He thinks for a moment.  "It is what it is.  You should not group people based on their species but based on their actions.  And you should remember that when you're eventually outnumbered and outgunned."  He raises his hand to cut off any objections.  "I know, you'll never be outmatched by these <I>infidels</I>. But they may, eventually have some brilliant idea that confuses you long enough for them to defeat you.  It happens to the best of us."  He nods curtly.  "Now if you'll excuse me, I have a dog to find."</FONT></HTML>
